info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 2:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... ...MARINERS ON EASTERN LAKE MARION SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 224 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Eadytown, or 17 miles south of Manning, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...strong winds 45 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Saint Stephen, Eadytown, Eastern Lake Marion, and Northern Lake Moultrie. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on the eastern portions of Lake Marion should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
